channel.title: algebraic-topology on Semantic Tree
channel.description: Recent content in algebraic-topology on Semantic Tree

item.title: Simplicial Homology
item.description: We discuss the problem of hole-counting within topological spaces. Following an example motivated by graphs, we find that certain topological spaces can be triangulated to objects called simplicial complexes. We then develop a framework to compute holes by counting the independent cycles in a simplicial complex. Finally, we formalize this framework into the concept of homology groups.
